alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Forsyth and Davidson Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 915 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms over Davidson County. One storm was located near Lexington, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winston-Salem, Lexington, Thomasville, Clemmons, Bermuda Run, Linwood, Denton, Gordontown, High Rock Lake and Arcadia. This includes the following highways... Interstate 85 between Mile Markers 83 and 104. Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 182 and 187, and between Mile Markers 189 and 201. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
